bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this regulation:

bcl:definition.bcl:text: hunting companion means a person who is hunting for the limited purposes of assisting a person who holds a permit under section 2 (aa) or (bb) of the Permit Regulation;
licence year means the period commencing April 1 in a calendar year and ending March 31 of the following calendar year;
Permit Regulation means the Permit Regulation, B.C. Reg. 253/2000;
supervising hunter means a person who accompanies and provides close personal supervision of another person under section 11 (5), 17.1 or 17.2 of the Act;
unexamined non-resident or non-resident alien means a non-resident or non-resident alien who

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: has not successfully completed the examinations referred to in section 17 (1) of the Act, and
is not described in section 110.3 of the Act;

bcl:definition.bcl:text: youth hunting licence means a hunting licence issued to a parent or guardian on behalf of a child or ward in accordance with section 17.1 (2) of the Act.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Repealed. [B.C. Reg. 166/2001, s. 2.]

bcl:section.bcl:text: Repealed. [B.C. Reg. 340/2005, s. 5.]

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Condition of a hunting licence — unexamined non-residents and non-resident aliens
bcl:section.bcl:text: It is a condition of every hunting licence that the holder must not hunt wildlife unless accompanied by a person described in section 17 (2) (a), (b) or (c) of the Act if the holder was, at the time the licence was issued, an unexamined non-resident or non-resident alien.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 11 (1) (c) of the Act, a person who hunts any of the following species must hold an uncancelled species licence for that species:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: bison;
black bear;
black-tailed deer;
bobcat;
caribou;
cougar;
elk;
Repealed. [B.C. Reg. 52/2018, Sch. 2, s. 1.]
lynx;
moose;
mountain goat;
mountain sheep;
mule deer;
white-tailed deer;
wolverine.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 11 (1) (c) of the Act, a non-resident or non-resident alien who hunts wolf must hold an uncancelled species licence for wolf.
For the purposes of section 11 (1) (c) of the Act, a non-resident or non-resident alien who hunts upland game birds must hold an upland game bird licence.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Exemptions — hunting companion for disabled hunter permit holder

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Section 5 (1) does not apply to a hunting companion.
Section 7 does not apply to a hunting companion who is assisting a person

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: who holds a permit under section 2 (aa) of the Permit Regulation, if, after the hunting companion kills the big game and before the permit holder or hunting companion handles the big game killed, the permit holder cancels the appropriate species licence, or

who holds a permit under section 2 (bb) of the Permit Regulation, if, after the hunting companion kills the big game and before the hunting companion handles the big game killed, the hunting companion cancels the appropriate species licence of the permit holder on behalf of the permit holder.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Condition of hunting licence of hunting companion
bcl:section.bcl:text: It is a condition of the hunting licence of a hunting companion assisting a person who holds a permit under section 2 (bb) of the Permit Regulation that the hunting companion may be named for those purposes on the permit of only one permit holder each licence year.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Section 5 (1) does not apply to a person if the person is hunting only for the limited purposes of assisting a disabled hunter who, immediately before April 1, 2015, held a permit under section 3 (1) (c) (i) or (2) of the Permit Regulation, to track, kill or retrieve a game animal wounded by the disabled hunter.

Section 7 does not apply to a person exempted under subsection (1) if, after the person kills big game and before the disabled hunter or the person handles the big game killed, the disabled hunter cancels the appropriate species licence in accordance with the instructions on the licence.
The exemptions in subsections (1) and (2) apply only while the permit referred to in subsection (1) is valid.
Repealed. [B.C. Reg. 74/2017, App. 4, s. 4.]
Section 5 (1) does not apply to a person in respect of a species if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a youth hunting licence is held on the person's behalf, and
the person is hunting with a supervising hunter who holds an uncancelled species licence for the species.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Section 5 (2) does not apply to a person if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a youth hunting licence is held on the person's behalf, and
the person is hunting with a supervising hunter who

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: holds an uncancelled species licence for wolf.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Section 5 (3) does not apply to a person if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a youth hunting licence is held on the person's behalf, and
the person is hunting with a supervising hunter who

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: holds an upland game bird licence.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Section 7 does not apply to a person exempted under subsection (2) of this section, if, after the person kills big game and before any person handles the big game killed, the supervising hunter cancels the appropriate species licence in accordance with the instructions on the licence.
Section 7 does not apply to a person exempted under subsection (2.1) of this section if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the supervising hunter is a resident, or
after the person kills a wolf and before any person handles the wolf killed, the supervising hunter cancels a species licence for wolf in accordance with the instructions on the licence.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Section 5 (1) does not apply to a person if the person holds an initiation hunting licence and the person is hunting with a supervising hunter who holds an uncancelled species licence for the species hunted.

Section 7 does not apply to a person exempted under subsection (1) of this section, if, after the person kills big game and before any person handles the big game killed, the supervising hunter cancels the appropriate species licence in accordance with the instructions on the licence.
Section 5 (1) and (2) does not apply to a supervising hunter if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the supervising hunter is hunting with a person who holds an uncancelled species licence for black bear, cougar or wolf,
the person is less than 18 years of age, and
the person wounds wildlife for which the species licence is issued.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Section 5 (1) does not apply to a resident who holds a permit issued under section 70 (1) (a) of the Act if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the resident is hunting with a non-resident or non-resident alien in respect of whom the permit is issued,
the non-resident or non-resident alien holds an uncancelled species licence for black bear or cougar, and
the non-resident or non-resident alien wounds wildlife for which the species licence is issued.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Section 5 (1) and (2) does not apply to a guide outfitter or assistant guide who holds a hunting licence if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the guide outfitter or assistant guide is hunting with, and guiding, a person who holds an uncancelled species licence for black bear, cougar or wolf, and
the person wounds wildlife for which the species licence is issued.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Section 7 does not apply to a person exempted under subsection (1), (2) or (3) of this section if, after the person kills the wounded wildlife and before any person handles that wildlife, the person who holds the appropriate species licence cancels the species licence in accordance with the instructions on that licence.
To be eligible for a species licence, a person must

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: hold a hunting licence, other than an initiation hunting licence or a youth hunting licence, and
if the person is a non-resident or non-resident alien, demonstrate that the person is to be accompanied by

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: an assistant guide issued a written authorization under section 48 (1.2) of the Act, or
another person who holds a permit issued under section 70 (1) (a) of the Act that authorizes the other person to accompany the person who is the non-resident or non-resident alien.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subsection (1) does not apply to a person described in section 11 (9) of the Act who intends to serve as a supervising hunter.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Eligibility for upland game bird licence

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: To be eligible for an upland game bird licence, a person must hold a hunting licence, other than a youth hunting licence.
Subsection (1) does not apply to a person described in section 11 (9) of the Act who intends to serve as a supervising hunter for a person on whose behalf a youth hunting licence is held.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Species licence not valid until 2 days after the date of issue
bcl:section.bcl:text: A species licence for bobcat, caribou, cougar, lynx, mountain goat, mountain sheep or wolverine is not valid until 2 days after the date of issue.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If a person hunts and kills wildlife in respect of which the person is required to hold a species licence, the person commits an offence unless, immediately after killing the wildlife and before handling the wildlife killed, the person cancels the species licence in accordance with the instructions on that licence.
Repealed. [B.C. Reg. 84/2001, s. 2.]

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Condition of hunting licence — carry all species licences
bcl:section.bcl:text: It is a condition of every hunting licence that the holder must not hunt wildlife unless the holder

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: carries, while hunting, each species licence issued to the holder during the term of the holder's hunting licence, whether or not any species licence has been cancelled, and
produces, on the request of an officer, all species licences referred to in paragraph (a).

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Issuing hunting licences to persons under 18 years of age
bcl:section.bcl:text: A person commits an offence if the person issues a hunting licence to, or on behalf of, a person who is under 18 years of age contrary to section 17.1 (1) of the Act.
Repealed. [B.C. Reg. 127/2017, App. 4, s. 7.]
Repealed. [B.C. Reg. 78/2016, App. 1, s. 5.]
Repealed. [B.C. Reg. 127/2017, App. 4, s. 7.]

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Prescribed qualifications — supervising an underage hunter
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of sections 11 (5) (c) and 17.1 (1) (c), (3) (d) and (g) and (4) (e) of the Act, the following qualifications are prescribed:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: Repealed. [B.C. Reg. 127/2017, App. 4, s. 8 (a).]
the person has successfully completed the examinations referred to in section 17 (1) of the Act or is described in section 110.3 of the Act;

the person must have held a hunting licence, other than an initiation hunting licence or a youth hunting licence, in British Columbia, or a licence to hunt in another jurisdiction, in not fewer than 3 of any of the licence years preceding the current licence year;
if the person is described in section 11 (9) of the Act, paragraphs (b.1) and (c) do not apply and the person must have

the person must not be prohibited from carrying or possessing a firearm under section 24 of the Act or an enactment of Canada, a province or territory of Canada, the United States of America, a state of the United States of America or another jurisdiction.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Prescribed qualifications — supervising an initiation hunter

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to subsection (2), the following qualifications are prescribed for the purposes of section 17.2 (2) (b) and (3) (b) and (d) of the Act:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the person must be a resident;
the person must hold a hunting licence, other than an initiation hunting licence or a youth hunting licence;

the person must have held a hunting licence, other than an initiation hunting licence or a youth hunting licence, in British Columbia, or a licence to hunt in another jurisdiction, in not fewer than 3 of any of the licence years preceding the current licence year;
if the person is described in section 11 (9) of the Act, paragraphs (a) to (c) do not apply and the person must have

the person must not be prohibited from carrying or possessing a firearm under section 24 of the Act or an enactment of Canada or a province or territory of Canada, the United States of America, a state of the United States of America or another jurisdiction.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If the person who holds an initiation hunting licence or a youth hunting licence referred to in section 17.2 (2) and (3) of the Act, while hunting wildlife, is accompanied by a guide outfitter, or an assistant guide issued a written authorization under section 48 (1.2) of the Act, who is guiding the person, the following qualifications are prescribed for the purposes of section 17.2 (2) (b) and (3) (b) and (d) of the Act:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the supervising hunter must be a resident;
the supervising hunter must hold a hunting licence, other than an initiation hunting licence or a youth hunting licence, or be exempted from holding a hunting licence.

bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of sections 11 (5), 17.1 and 17.2 of the Act, a supervising hunter commits an offence if the supervising hunter accompanies and supervises, at the same time, more than a total of 2 of any of the following persons:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a person who holds an initiation hunting licence;
a person on whose behalf a youth hunting licence is held.
Repealed. [B.C. Reg. 16/2023, App. 1, s. 1.]

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Condition of an initiation hunting licence
bcl:section.bcl:text: It is a condition of every initiation hunting licence that the holder of the licence must do all of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: before starting to hunt on each day of hunting,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: record in ink, on a form specified by the director, the name of the supervising hunter for that day, and
ensure that that supervising hunter has

bcl:clause.bcl:text: read the information set out on the form, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: carry the form while hunting and produce it to an officer on request.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Number of initiation hunting licences limited to one
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 14 of the Act, a person must not obtain or hold more than one initiation hunting licence in the person's lifetime.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Number of licences limited to one
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purpose of section 14 of the Act, during a licence year, a person must not obtain or hold more than one of each of the following licences:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a hunting licence, other than a hunting licence described in paragraph (a.1), (a.2) or (a.3);
a youth hunting licence issued to the person in respect of a particular person under 18 years of age;
an initiation hunting licence;
a hunting licence issued to the person when the person was an unexamined non-resident or non-resident alien;
a bison species licence;
a caribou species licence;
an elk species licence;
Repealed. [B.C. Reg. 52/2018, Sch. 2, s. 1.]
a lynx species licence;
a moose species licence;
a mountain goat species licence;
a mountain sheep species licence;
Repealed. [B.C. Reg. 127/2017, App. 4, s. 12 (b).]
a wolverine species licence;
an upland game bird licence.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purpose of section 14 of the Act, the maximum number of licences of each kind that a person may obtain or hold, during each licence year, is as follows:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: 2 black bear species licences;
5 bobcat species licences;
2 cougar species licences;
3 mule deer species licences;
15 Haida Gwaii deer species licences;
10 wolf species licences;
3 white-tailed deer species licences.
Repealed. [B.C. Reg. 167/2007, s. (b).]

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Repealed. [B.C. Reg. 138/2002, s. (b).]

bcl:section.bcl:text: If a person, during a licence year, obtains or holds more than 15 of any combination of

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: mule deer species licences,
Haida Gwaii deer species licences, and
white-tailed deer species licences

bcl:section.bcl:text: the person commits an offence.
Repealed. [B.C. Reg. 78/2016, App. 1, s. 5.]
A duplicate copy of a species licence may be issued if the holder of the licence

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: completes a statement of loss in the form specified by the director, and
pays the fee set out in the Schedule.

bcl:section.bcl:text: The fees and habitat conservation trust fund surcharges payable for a licence set out in the Schedule are those set out opposite the licence in the Schedule.
It is an offence to issue oneself a licence listed in the Schedule.
Any wildlife taken or killed by a person who holds an initiation hunting licence is included in the bag limit of the supervising hunter.
Any wildlife, other than migratory game birds, taken or killed by a person on whose behalf a youth hunting licence is held is included in the bag limit of the supervising hunter.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Hunting companion for disabled hunter — bag limit

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Any wildlife taken or killed by a person referred to in section 5.1 on behalf of a person who holds a permit referred to in that section is included in the bag limit of the permit holder.
Any wildlife taken or killed by a person referred to in section 5.12 on behalf of a person who holds a permit referred to in that section is included in the bag limit of the permit holder.

bcl:section.bcl:text: Repealed. [B.C. Reg. 38/2013, App. 1, s. 10.]

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If a person under the age of 18 years, while hunting wildlife, is accompanied by a guide outfitter or assistant guide who is guiding the person, section 11 (5) (c) of the Act does not apply.
If a person on whose behalf a youth hunting licence is held, while hunting wildlife, is accompanied by a guide outfitter or assistant guide who is guiding the person

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: section 17.1 (1) (c), (3) (d) and (g) and (4) (e) of the Act does not apply to the supervising hunter,
section 56 (1) of the Act does not apply to the guide outfitter or assistant guide in respect of the requirement under that section that the hunter hold a hunting licence, and
section 21 of this regulation does not apply to any small game taken or killed by the person and the person may kill and possess small game as if the person held a hunting licence.

bcl:section.bcl:text: Repealed. [B.C. Reg. 16/2023, App. 1, s. 3.]
In this Part:

bcl:definition.bcl:text: special area means the Fraser Valley special hunting area comprised of MU 2-4 and those areas within MU 2-8 that are within the corporate limits of The Corporation of The District of Maple Ridge, The Corporation of The District of Pitt Meadows, The District of Mission, and The Corporation of the City of Coquitlam.

bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 11 (1) (c) of the Act, a person who hunts wildlife in the special area must hold a Fraser Valley special area licence.
Section 25 does not apply

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the person hunts wildlife on property owned by a commercial game club which holds a permit for that purpose under the Act, or
to a person under the age of 18 years.

bcl:section.bcl:text: A person other than to whom section 26 applies commits an offence if the person hunts wildlife in the special area unless the person is the holder of public liability and property damage insurance in the amount of $1 000 000 or more, sold by a licensed insurer in the Province, that covers the hunter while hunting in the Province.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: An application for a Fraser Valley special area licence must include a declaration, in the form specified by the director, by the applicant that the applicant holds the insurance required by section 27.
A person commits an offence if the person issues a Fraser Valley special area licence to an applicant whose application does not conform to subsection (1).

bcl:section.bcl:text: In this Part:

bcl:definition.bcl:text: special area means the Gulf Islands special hunting area comprised of Denman and Hornby Islands and all islands within MU 1-1 except Vancouver Island.

bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 11 (1) (c) of the Act, a person who hunts wildlife in the special area must hold a Gulf Islands special area licence.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Insurance or guide required and exemption

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person commits an offence if the person hunts wildlife in the special area unless the person

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: is the holder of public liability and property damage insurance in the amount of $100 000 or more, sold by a licensed insurer in the Province, that covers the hunter while hunting in the Province, or
is guided by a guide outfitter or assistant guide.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Section 30 and subsection (1) do not apply to a person under the age of 18 years.
An application for a Gulf Islands special area licence must include a declaration, in the form specified by the director, by the applicant that the applicant

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: holds the insurance required by section 31, or
is to be accompanied, while hunting in the special area, by

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: an assistant guide issued a written authorization under section 48 (1.2) of the Act.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person commits an offence if the person issues a Gulf Islands special area licence to an applicant whose application does not conform to subsection (1).
